Alongside "If I Were a Boy", the song was released to U.S. radio stations on October 8, 2008.

The music video for "Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)" was directed by Jake Nava, whom Knowles had worked with on her previous videos. In a black and white tone, Knowles is performing as her alter ego Sasha Fierce. It shows her in asymmetrical leotard and high-heels, with two other female dancers. The video is choreography-driven, with routines that encompasses hip-and-leg shaking, and heels clicking, "almost as if they&#039;re tap dancing, to give the song some extra beats". Towards the end of the video, Knowles flashes her wedding ring that is almost camouflaging with her cyborg arm.

Knowles premiered the music video, along side the video for "If I Were a Boy", on MTV&#039;s Total Request Live show. The video was released to major outlets on October 13, 2008. Upon the video&#039;s release, many internet bloggers noticed similarities between "Single Ladies" and "Mexican Breakfast" in terms of choreography. While promoting the song on BET&#039;s 106 & Park, Knowles stated that she was inspired by the video after viewing it on YouTube and wanted to see if she could attempt it. Another video by Knowles, "Get Me Bodied", was inspired by Fosse&#039;s musical Sweet Charity.
